divs: Sighting DetailsMy daughter and I were driving home from Lodi around 6:45 PM, and, as usual, we were talking when I decided to look out and see if I could see any stars as the weather was finally clear. Just above us, but slightly to the south, I saw a flashing light. Very bright, very white, and flashing like a strobe light does. It was, from where I was about the size of an M & M candy, and traveling rather too slowly to be a plane. I would estimate it was probably about 30,000 ft. up. It continued on a southward path while just a few degrees lower to the southwest a plane was going to the east with its standard red and green lights flashing. My daughter said, that's just a plane., but from the drivers seat she could not see the strobe like thing. Since we were driving, of course I could not determine if there was any sound I can't discount that this might be a plane, but certainly I have never seen a plane using those kind of lights. It actually looked to be a ball of light rather than lights spaced along the length of something. I watched it for approx 12 minutes until it vanished in the south. Because there was no near 'contact' I cannot describe any unusual effects, except that I spent a very restless night constantly seeing the thing in my mind and wondering what it could have been. Any ideas what this might be?
